item.title: Allen add a quote by Margaret Mead
item.description: "Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed, citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has." -- Margaret Mead

item.title: Allen add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Good writing is good conversation, only more so." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Allen add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Style is a sort of melody that comes into my sentences by itself. If a writer says what he has to say as accurately and effectively as he can, his style will take care of itself." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Allen add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "Conventionality is not morality. Self-righteousness is not religion. To attack the first is not to assail the last." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Allen add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "They have pulled down deep heaven on their heads." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Allen add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The devil can cite Scripture for his purpose." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Allen add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "All generalizations are dangerous, even this one." -- Alexandre Dumas

item.title: Allen add a quote by John Dryden
item.description: "Beware the fury of a patient man." -- John Dryden

item.title: Allen add a quote by Hemingway, Ernest
item.description: "The most essential gift for a good writer is a built-in, shockproof, shit detector." -- Hemingway, Ernest

item.title: Allen add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "Genuine poetry can communicate before it is understood." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Allen add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The difference between the right word and the almost right word is the difference between lightning and a lightning bug." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Allen add a quote by John Stuart Mill
item.description: "War is an ugly thing, but not the ugliest of things: the decayed and degraded state of moral and patriotic feeling which thinks that nothing is worth a war, is much worse. When a people are used as mere human instruments for firing cannon or thrusting bayonets, in the service and for the selfish purposes of a master, such war degrades a people. A war to protect other human beings against tyrannical injustice; a war to give victory to their own ideas of right and good, and which is their own war, carried on for an honest purpose by their free choice, — is often the means of their regeneration. A man who has nothing which he is willing to fight for, nothing which he cares more about than he does about his personal safety, is a miserable creature who has no chance of being free, unless made and kept so by the exertions of better men than himself. As long as justice and injustice have not terminated their ever-renewing fight for ascendancy in the affairs of mankind, human beings must be willing, when need is, to do battle for the one against the other." -- John Stuart Mill

item.title: Allen add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "All great truths begin as blasphemies." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Allen add a quote by James Thurber
item.description: "I do not have a psychiatrist and I do not want one, for the simple reason that if he listened to me long enough, he might become disturbed." -- James Thurber

item.title: Allen add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "In this country we have no place for hyphenated Americans." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Allen add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Courage is found in unlikely places." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Allen add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "They might be dirty, and cheap, and their food might taste like shit, but at least they didn’t speak in clichés" -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Allen add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Allen add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: Allen add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Allen add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "To love at all is to be vulnerable. Love anything and your heart will be wrung and possibly broken. If you want to make sure of keeping it intact you must give it to no one, not even an animal. Wrap it carefully round with hobbies and little luxuries; avoid all entanglements. Lock it up safe in the casket or coffin of your selfishness. But in that casket, safe, dark, motionless, airless, it will change. It will not be broken; it will become unbreakable, impenetrable, irredeemable. To love is to be vulnerable." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Allen add a quote by Ralph Hodgson
item.description: "Some things have to be believed to be seen." -- Ralph Hodgson

item.title: Allen add a quote by Christopher Paolini
item.description: "Perhaps not one religion contains all of the truth of the world. Perhaps every religion contains fragments of the truth, and it is our responsibility to identify those fragments and piece them together." -- Christopher Paolini

item.title: Allen add a quote by Gore Vidal
item.description: "Traitors who prevail are patriots; usurpers who succeed are divine emperors." -- Gore Vidal

item.title: Allen add a quote by Robert Jordan
item.description: "Dance with her, and she will forgive much. Dance well, and she will forgive anything." -- Robert Jordan

item.title: Allen add a quote by Terry Goodkind
item.description: "Culture carries no privilege to exist. Cultures do not have value simply because they are. Some cultures, the world is better off without." -- Terry Goodkind

item.title: Allen add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Use the right word, not its second cousin." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Allen add a quote by Bernard Malamud
item.description: "Without heroes we're all plain people and don't know how far we can go." -- Bernard Malamud
